member.name: T:Octopus.Client.DefaultLinkResolver
member.summary: In the same way web browsers can follow links like "/api/foo" by knowing the URI of the current page, this class allows application links to be resolved into fully-qualified URI's. This implementation also supports virtual directories. It assumes that the API endpoint starts with /api.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.ILinkResolver
member.summary: In the same way web browsers can follow links like "/foo" by knowing the URI of the current page, this class allows application links to be resolved into fully-qualified URI's.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.ILinkResolver.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the specified link into a fully qualified URI.
member.param: The application relative link (should begin with a /).
member.returns: The fully resolved URI.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.DefaultLinkResolver.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The root URI of the server.
A segment that users might or might not include when entering the root URI. If the segment exists, it will be ignored.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.DefaultLinkResolver.Resolve(System.String)
member.summary: Resolves the specified link into a fully qualified URI.
member.param: The application relative link (should begin with a /).
member.returns: The fully resolved URI.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.DefaultLinkResolver.ToString
member.summary: Returns a that represents the root URI that URI's are resolved from.
member.returns: A that represents this instance.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Exceptions.OctopusMethodNotAllowedFoundException
member.summary: An exception thrown when the Octopus Server responds with HTTP 405, which indicates that the HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE) is not supported on the specified resource.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Exceptions.OctopusSecurityException
member.summary: An exception thrown when the Octopus Server responds with HTTP 401 or 403, indicating that the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.

The message.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

The message.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.IOctopusClient
member.summary: Contract for a client to the Octopus Deploy HTTP API.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.IOctopusClient.List``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Fetches a collection of resources from the server using the HTTP GET verb. The collection itself will usually be limited in size (pagination) and links to the next page of data is available in the property.
member.exception: HTTP 401 or 403: Thrown when the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.
If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
If the path is a URI template, parameters to use for substitution.
member.returns: The collection of resources from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.IOctopusClient.Paginate``1(System.String,System.Func{Octopus.Client.Model.ResourceCollection{``0},System.Boolean})
member.summary: Fetches a collection of resources from the server one page at a time using the HTTP GET verb.
member.exception: HTTP 401 or 403: Thrown when the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.
If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
A callback invoked for each page of data found. If the callback returns true, the next page will also be requested.
member.returns: The collection of resources from the server.

member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
If the path is a URI template, parameters to use for substitution.
A callback invoked for each page of data found. If the callback returns true, the next page will also be requested.
member.returns: The collection of resources from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.IOctopusClient.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the resource at the given URI from the server using a the DELETE verb. Deletes in Octopus happen asynchronously via a background task that is executed by the Octopus server. The payload returned by delete will be the task that was created on the server.
member.exception: HTTP 401 or 403: Thrown when the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.
If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path to the resource to delete.
member.returns: A task resource that provides details about the background task that deletes the specified resource.

If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path to the resource to fetch.
member.returns: A stream containing the content of the resource.

A stream containing content of the resource.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.IOctopusClient.RootDocument
member.summary: Gets a document that identifies the Octopus server (from /api) and provides links to the resources available on the server. Instead of hardcoding paths, clients should use these link properties to traverse the resources on the server. This document is lazily loaded so that it is only requested once for the current .

HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.

member.summary: Gets or sets a dictionary of links to other related resources. These links can be used to navigate the resources on the server.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.ArtifactResource
member.summary: Artifacts are files like documents and test results that may be stored alongside a release.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ArtifactResource.Filename
member.summary: Gets or sets the filename of the Artifact to create. An example might be "Performance Test Results.csv".
member.remarks: The filename should not include path information.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ArtifactResource.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets a short summary of the source of this attachment. This will typically be the name of a step/machine, or "Uploaded by [username]" if the attachment was uploaded by a person.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ArtifactResource.RelatedDocumentIds
member.summary: Gets or sets the documents with which this artifact is associated.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ArtifactResource.Created
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the artifact was created.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.DeploymentResource.SpecificMachineIds
member.summary: A collection of machines in the target environment that should be deployed to. If the collection is empty, all enabled machines are deployed.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.DeploymentResource.UseGuidedFailure
member.summary: If set to true, the deployment will prompt for manual intervention (Fail/Retry/Ignore) when failures are encountered in activities that support it. May be overridden with the Octopus.UseGuidedFailure special variable.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.DeploymentResource.QueueTime
member.summary: If set this time will be the used to schedule the deployment to a later time, null is assumed to mean the time will be executed immediately.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.DeploymentStepResource.RequiresPackagesToBeAcquired
member.summary: This flag causes packages to be downloaded before the step runs regardless of whether any of the actions within the step need packages. If the actions need packages, then the step will be scheduled after acquisition regardless of the value of this flag.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.EnvironmentResource
member.summary: Represents an environment. Environments are user-defined and map to real world deployment environments such as development, staging, test and production. Projects are deployed to environments.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EnvironmentResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this environment. This should be short, preferably 5-20 characters.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EnvironmentResource.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a short description of this environment that can be used to explain the purpose of the environment to other users. This field may contain markdown.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EnvironmentResource.SortOrder
member.summary: Gets or sets a number indicating the priority of this environment in sort order. Environments with a lower sort order will appear in the UI before items with a higher sort order.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EnvironmentResource.UseGuidedFailure
member.summary: If set to true, deployments will prompt for manual intervention (Fail/Retry/Ignore) when failures are encountered in activities that support it. May be overridden with the Octopus.UseGuidedFailure special variable.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource
member.summary: Events are automatically created when significant actions take place within Octopus by users. Examples are adding environments, modifying projects, deploying releases, cancelling tasks, and so on. Events can be used to provide an audit trail of what has happened in the system. The HTTP API *cannot* be used to add, modify or delete events.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.RelatedDocumentIds
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of document ID's that this event relates to. Note that the document ID's may no longer exist.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the event category.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.UserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the user who created the event.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Username
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the user who created the event.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.IdentityEstablishedWith
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of how the user performing the event identified themselves to Octopus.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Occurred
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time that the event took place.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the message text that summarizes the event.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.MessageHtml
member.summary: Gets or sets the message text that summarizes the event, HTML formatted with links to the related documents.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.MessageReferences
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of document ID's and indexes where they are mentioned in the message text.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Comments
member.summary: Gets or sets any user-provided comments that were recorded with the event.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.EventResource.Details
member.summary: Gets or sets the details of the event. For events representing a modification to a document this will provide a HTML-formatted diff of the original and new document.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource
member.summary: An interruption is a request by a process running in the Octopus server for user action or input.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets a title for this interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.Created
member.summary: Gets the time at which the interruption was created.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.IsPending
member.summary: True if the interruption is waiting for user action; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.Form
member.summary: Gets the form requesting user input.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.RelatedDocumentIds
member.summary: Gets the ids of documents related to this interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.ResponsibleTeamIds
member.summary: Gets the ids of groups that can take responsibility for this interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.ResponsibleUserId
member.summary: Gets or sets the

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.CanTakeResponsibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current user has permissions to take responsibility for this interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.HasResponsibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current user has responsibility for this interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.TaskId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the Server Task raising the interruption.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.InterruptionResource.CorrelationId
member.summary: Gets or sets the correlation ID of the activity in which the interruption was requested, if any.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.LoginCommand
member.summary: A command resource used for logging in.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LoginCommand.Username
member.summary: The username to log in with.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LoginCommand.Password
member.summary: The password to log in with.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LoginCommand.RememberMe
member.summary: Whether the cookie should be persistent.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ReleaseTemplatePackage.IsResolvable
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the or contain no references to other variables. Variables can be used to select different NuGet feeds or packages at deployment time, however, this means that it's not possible to resolve which feed/package to search when creating a release.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.NotReadableAttribute
member.summary: Properties with this attribute can be set from API clients, but the value won't exist for resources returned from the server. Commonly used for fields like passwords or API keys that allow a value to be written, but not read.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.PasswordComplexityAttribute
member.summary: A custom validation rule that ensures passwords meet complexity requirements.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.Model.PasswordComplexityAttribute.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectGroupResource
member.summary: Project groups are used to organize collections of related projects. For example, a customer may have a project group named "Corporate Website" containing three seperate projects. Project groups affect retention policies and permissions.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectGroupResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this project group.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectGroupResource.EnvironmentIds
member.summary: Gets or sets a collection of environment ID's. If this collection is empty, projects in this group can be deployed to any environment. If the collection is non-empty, then projects in the group are limited to only deploying to the environments listed in this collection.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectGroupResource.RetentionPolicyId
member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the retention policy that will apply to projects in this group.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectResource
member.summary: Represents a project.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ProjectResource.IncludedLibraryVariableSetIds
member.summary: Library variable sets included in the project. Sets are listed in order of precedence, with earlier items in the list overriding any variables with the same name and scope definition appearing later in the list.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.UserResource.IsRequestor
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this user resource represents the user who requested it.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.ReleaseResource.LibraryVariableSetSnapshotIds
member.summary: Snapshots of the project's included library variable sets. The snapshots are s, not s.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource
member.summary: Octopus doesn't just store information; it actively *does* things. Examples include deployments, checking that machines are online, automated database backups, and more. These "tasks" are queued and executed asynchronously, and their progress and logs can be monitored using the HTTP API. Some tasks are created automatically; for example, Octopus will automatically create a task to check the status of all machines every 5 minutes. Some tasks are created implicitly, such as when a deployment is created to execute the actual deployment. And some tasks can be created manually, such as backup tasks and sending test emails.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new .

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the task to create. This name must be one of the list of possible names documented in the create API operation documentation.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a short, human-understandable description of this task. An example might be "Manual database backup". This is the name that will be shown in the task list.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.Arguments
member.summary: Gets or sets any arguments to the task.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.State
member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the task.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.Completed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the completion status of the task. May be "Timed out", "Queued...", "Executing...", or the time at which the task completed for completed tasks.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.QueueTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the task was queued.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.StartTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time at which the task started executing.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.LastUpdatedTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the time that the Octopus server last updated the status of this task. For a running task this should happen at least every couple of minutes.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.CompletedTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the date/time that the task completed. Will be null if the task has not yet completed.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.Duration
member.summary: Gets or sets a string indicating how long the task took to run.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.ErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a short summary of the errors encountered when the task ran (if any).

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.HasBeenPickedUpByProcessor
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value indicating whether the Octopus Server is processing this task.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.IsCompleted
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the task has completed (that is, not queued, not running, and not paused; may have finished successfully or failed).

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.FinishedSuccessfully
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the task ran to completion successfully.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.HasPendingInterruptions
member.summary: True if the task is waiting for manual intervention.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.CanRerun
member.summary: If true, then the task can be used as the basis for a new task with the same effect.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TaskResource.HasWarningsOrErrors
member.summary: True if any warnings or non-fatal errors were recorded in the task log during execution.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource
member.summary: A group of users that can be assigned to roles in projects and environments.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this team.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.MemberUserIds
member.summary: The users who belong to the team.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.ExternalSecurityGroups
member.summary: The externally-managed security groups (e.g., Active Directory groups) who belong to the team.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.UserRoleIds
member.summary: The roles that the team belongs to.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.ProjectIds
member.summary: The projects that the team can exercise its roles in. If empty, the team can exercise its roles in all projects.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.EnvironmentIds
member.summary: The environments that the team can exercise its roles in. If empty, the team can exercise its roles in all environments.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.CanBeDeleted
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the team can be deleted. The built-in teams provided by Octopus generally cannot be deleted.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.CanBeRenamed
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the team can be renamed. The built-in teams provided by Octopus generally cannot be renamed.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.CanChangeRoles
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the team's roles can be changed. The built-in Octopus Administrators team provided by Octopus cannot have its roles modified; all other teams can.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.TeamResource.CanChangeMembers
member.summary: Gets or sets a flag indicating whether the members of this team can be changed. The built-in Everyone team provided by Octopus cannot have its members changed, as it will always contain all users.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Exceptions.UnsupportedApiVersionException
member.summary: An exception thrown when the Octopus Server supports a version of the API that is incompatible with this class library.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.Exceptions.UnsupportedApiVersionException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The message that describes the error.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionRestriction
member.summary: Describes the scope of a permission granted to a user.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionRestriction.RestrictedToProjectIds
member.summary: Restrictions on the projects to which the permission applies, if any.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionRestriction.RestrictedToEnvironmentIds
member.summary: Restrictions on the environments to which the permission applies, if any.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionSetResource
member.summary: Summarizes the permissions assigned to a user via their team membership.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionSetResource.Permissions
member.summary: Lists individual permissions granted, including restrictions where applicable.
member.remarks: Multiple entries may exist for any permission if different restrictions are applied. Duplicate or redundant entries may be excluded.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.UserPermissionSetResource.Teams
member.summary: Gets the teams that the user is a member of.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.LibraryVariableSetResource
member.summary: A standalone variable set that can be included in projects where required.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LibraryVariableSetResource.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of this variable set. This should be short, preferably 5-20 characters.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LibraryVariableSetResource.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets a description of this variable set that explains the purpose of the variable set to other users. This field may contain markdown.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LibraryVariableSetResource.VariableSetId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of the associated variable set.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.LibraryVariableSetResource.ContentType
member.summary: Describes the purpose of the variable set. Clients can use this to offer an editing experience appropriately.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.Model.UserRoleResource
member.summary: A role played by users.

member.summary: Gets or sets the ID of the document that owns these variables.

member.summary: Gets the collection of variables.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Model.VariableSetResource.ScopeValues
member.summary: Gets the scope values that apply to the variables.

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.OctopusRepository
member.summary: A simplified interface to commonly-used parts of the API. Functionality not exposed by this interface can be accessed using .

Create using:
var repository = new OctopusRepository(new OctopusServerEndpoint("http://myoctopus/"));

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint
member.summary: Specifies the location and credentials to use when communicating with an Octopus Deploy server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Since no API key is provided, only very limited functionality will be available.
member.param: The URI of the Octopus Server. Ideally this should end with /api. If it ends with any other segment, the client will assume Octopus runs under a virtual directory.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The URI of the Octopus Server. Ideally this should end with /api. If it ends with any other segment, the client will assume Octopus runs under a virtual directory.

The API key to use when connecting to the Octopus server. For more information on API keys, please see the API documentation on authentication (https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/blob/master/sections/authentication.md).

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The URI of the Octopus Server. Ideally this should end with /api. If it ends with any other segment, the client will assume Octopus runs under a virtual directory.

The API key to use when connecting to the Octopus server. For more information on API keys, please see the API documentation on authentication (https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/blob/master/sections/authentication.md).
Additional credentials to use when communicating to servers that require integrated/basic authentication.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.#ctor(Octopus.Client.ILinkResolver,System.String,System.Net.ICredentials)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The resolver that should be used to turn relative links into full URIs.

The API key to use when connecting to the Octopus server. For more information on API keys, please see the API documentation on authentication (https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/blob/master/sections/authentication.md).
Additional credentials to use when communicating to servers that require integrated/basic authentication.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.AsUser(System.String)
member.summary: Recreates the endpoint using the API key of a new user.
member.param: The new user API key.
member.returns: An endpoint with a new user.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.OctopusServer
member.summary: The URI of the Octopus Server. Ideally this should end with /api. If it ends with any other segment, the client will assume Octopus runs under a virtual directory.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.ApiKey
member.summary: Gets the API key to use when connecting to the Octopus server. For more information on API keys, please see the API documentation on authentication (https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/blob/master/sections/authentication.md).

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.OctopusServerEndpoint.Credentials

member.name: T:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient
member.summary: The Octopus Deploy RESTful HTTP API client.

member.summary: Initializes this instance.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Get``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Fetches a single resource from the server using the HTTP GET verb.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resource.
If the path is a URI template, parameters to use for substitution.
member.returns: The resource from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.List``1(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Fetches a collection of resources from the server using the HTTP GET verb. The collection itself will usually be limited in size (pagination) and links to the next page of data is available in the property.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
If the path is a URI template, parameters to use for substitution.
member.returns: The collection of resources from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Paginate``1(System.String,System.Object,System.Func{Octopus.Client.Model.ResourceCollection{``0},System.Boolean})
member.summary: Fetches a collection of resources from the server one page at a time using the HTTP GET verb.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
If the path is a URI template, parameters to use for substitution.
A callback invoked for each page of data found. If the callback returns true, the next page will also be requested.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Paginate``1(System.String,System.Func{Octopus.Client.Model.ResourceCollection{``0},System.Boolean})
member.summary: Fetches a collection of resources from the server one page at a time using the HTTP GET verb.
member.param: The path from which to fetch the resources.
A callback invoked for each page of data found. If the callback returns true, the next page will also be requested.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Create``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Creates a resource at the given URI on the server using the POST verb, then performs a fresh GET request to fetch the created item.
member.param: The path to the container resource.
The resource to create.
member.returns: The latest copy of the resource from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Post``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sends a command to a resource at the given URI on the server using the POST verb.
member.param: The path to the container resource.
The resource to create.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Post``2(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sends a command to a resource at the given URI on the server using the POST verb.
member.param: The path to the container resource.
The resource to post.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Post(System.String)
member.summary: Sends a command to a resource at the given URI on the server using the POST verb.
member.param: The path to the container resource.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Put``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Sends a command to a resource at the given URI on the server using the PUT verb.
member.exception: HTTP 401 or 403: Thrown when the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.
If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path to the container resource.
The resource to create.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the resource at the given URI from the server using a the DELETE verb. Deletes in Octopus happen asynchronously via a background task that is executed by the Octopus server. The payload returned by delete will be the task that was created on the server.
member.param: The path to the resource to delete.
member.returns: A task resource that provides details about the background task that deletes the specified resource.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Update``1(System.String,``0)
member.summary: Updates the resource at the given URI on the server using the PUT verb, then performs a fresh GET request to reload the data.
member.param: The path to the resource to update.
The resource to update.
member.returns: The latest copy of the resource from the server.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.GetContent(System.String)
member.summary: Fetches raw content from the resource at the specified path, using the GET verb.
member.exception: HTTP 401 or 403: Thrown when the current user's API key was not valid, their account is disabled, or they don't have permission to perform the specified action.
If any other error is successfully returned from the server (e.g., a 500 server error).
HTTP 400: If there was a problem with the request provided by the user.
HTTP 404: If the specified resource does not exist on the server.
member.param: The path to the resource to fetch.
member.returns: A stream containing the content of the resource.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.PutContent(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Creates or updates the raw content of the resource at the specified path, using the PUT verb.
member.param: The path to the resource to create or update.
A stream containing content of the resource.

member.name: M:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.Dispose

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.OctopusClient.RootDocument
member.summary: Gets a document that identifies the Octopus server (from /api) and provides links to the resources available on the server. Instead of hardcoding paths, clients should use these link properties to traverse the resources on the server. This document is lazily loaded so that it is only requested once for the current .

member.summary: Encapsulates the operation for registering machines.

member.summary: Executes the operation against the specified Octopus Deploy server.

member.summary: Executes the operation against the specified Octopus Deploy server.
member.param: The Octopus Deploy repository.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.EnvironmentNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the environments that this machine should be added to.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.Roles
member.summary: Gets or sets the roles that this machine belongs to.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.MachineName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the machine that will be used within Octopus to identify this machine.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.TentacleHostname
member.summary: Gets or sets the hostname that Octopus should use when communicating with the Tentacle.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.TentaclePort
member.summary: Gets or sets the TCP port that Octopus should use when communicating with the Tentacle.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.TentacleThumbprint
member.summary: Gets or sets the certificate thumbprint that Octopus should expect when communicating with the Tentacle.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.TentacleSquid
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQUID that the tentacle uses to uniquely identify itself. This value must be unique among all tentacles that connect to an Octopus server.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.AllowOverwrite
member.summary: If a machine with the same name already exists, it won't be overwritten by default (instead, an will be thrown). Set this property to true if you do want the existing machine to be overwritten.

member.name: P:Octopus.Client.Operations.IRegisterMachineOperation.CommunicationStyle
member.summary: The communication style to use with the Tentacle. Allowed values are: TentacleActive, in which case the Tentacle will connect to the Octopus server for instructions; or, TentaclePassive, in which case the Tentacle will listen for commands from the server (default).

member.summary: The communication style to use with the Tentacle. Allowed values are: TentacleActive, in which case the Tentacle will connect to the Octopus server for instructions; or, TentaclePassive, in which case the Tentacle will listen for commands from the server (default).
